game.IOStuff.audio

Class SoundLayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.IOStuff.audio.SoundLayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class SoundLayer
extends Object
implements Runnable
    This class handles audio file playing. Intended for background music playing. It will also work for other sounds.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SoundLayer(String audioFile)
      Constructor - Give it the String name of an audio file and it will try to load it up.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Declaring my own playOnce() method in order to make it as simple and straight forward as possible on the end user.
      void run()
      Implementing run() to make threading work.
      void setAudioFileName(String audioFile)
      Setter for the audioFileName; use this if you want to change the music file being played.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SoundLayer

        public SoundLayer(String audioFile)
        Constructor - Give it the String name of an audio file and it will try to load it up.
        Parameters:
        audioFile - A String corrisponding to the name of the audio file to be loaded. Can include file pathways in the name to locate the file, if not in current directory.

    • Method Detail

      • setAudioFileName

        public void setAudioFileName(String audioFile)
        Setter for the audioFileName; use this if you want to change the music file being played.
        Parameters:
        audioFile - A String corrisponding to the name of the audio file to be loaded. Can include file pathways in the name to locate the file, if not in current directory.

      • run

        public void run()
        Implementing run() to make threading work.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable

      • playLoop

        public void playLoop()
              throws SoundException
        Declaring my own playLoop() method in order to make it as simple and straight forward as possible on the end user. Also helps with exceptions. This method continuously loops the played sound.
        Throws:
        SoundException

      • playOnce

        public void playOnce()
              throws SoundException
        Declaring my own playOnce() method in order to make it as simple and straight forward as possible on the end user. Also helps with exceptions. This method plays the given sound only once.
        Throws:
        SoundException
